long: Meaning: to "gather" for any purpose; hence, to "receive", "take away", i.e. "remove" (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.).  Usage: assemble, bring, consume, destroy, felch, gather (in, together, up again), × generally, get (him), harvest, lose, put all together, receive, recover (another from leprosy), (be) rereward, × surely, take (away, into, up), × utterly, withdraw.  Source: a primitive root;
